feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 19 at 1:55AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels. This includes the city of Juneau. * WHEN...Through this afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations one to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits, White Mountains, Steese and Elliott Highway summits, and high terrain south of the Yukon

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting to around 40 mph. * WHERE...The Dalton Highway.

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued October 19 at 12:52AM AKDT until October 21 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 10 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...From 10 AM Friday to 10 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 19 at 12:52AM AKDT until October 21 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 11:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Expected Through Friday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1.5 feet above the normal high tide is expected along the Chukchi Sea coast, including Kotzebue Sound and north-facing coasts of the Seward Peninsula. North to northwesterly winds 25 to 40 mph will cause elevated surf for coastal areas of the Chukchi Sea. Winds will gradually decrease
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Noatak Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 11:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tonight Through Friday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1 foot above the normal high tide is expected along the western Arctic Coast from Point Hope to Wainwright. North to northwesterly winds from 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph near Cape Lisburne will develop near Wainwright Thursday night. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 11:26PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Friday and Saturday... Elevated and rough surf up to 1 foot above the normal high tide is expected along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik to Kaktovik. West to northwesterly winds will increase Friday to 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph, with stronger winds gusting to 55 mph at Kaktovik. Strong winds will cause elevated surf for coastal areas.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued October 18 at 10:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Near The Ward Lake Recreational Area. * WHEN...Until 730 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ketchikan Gateway Borough

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 8:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday and Thursday Night... Snowfall and gusty winds between 20 and 30 mph will develop early Thursday morning and persist into Thursday night, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow, especially over higher terrain. Snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches can be expected. Conditions are expected to improve Friday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chatanika River Valley; Upper Chena River Valley; Yukon Flats

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 18 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Thursday and Thursday Night... Snowfall and gusty winds between 20 and 30 mph will develop Thursday morning and persist into Thursday night, resulting in localized areas of blowing snow, especially over summits of the Dalton and Steese highways. Snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches can be expected. Conditions are expected to improve Friday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.summary: Fog was widespread across portions of the area with visibilities 1 to 1 1/2 miles, with patchy dense fog reducing visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 18 at 8:26PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to remain near or just below Moderate flood stage through midday on Thursday, then gradually fall through Minor flood stage into the weekend. For the St. Johns River...near Astor...Moderate flooding is forecast.
